item.title: SENSEX rises 400 pts in early trade; NIFTY50 trades above 23,750; Titan surges over 2%, Zomato drops 5% - Upstox
item.description:
Stock Market Gains: SENSEX Up 400 Points Amid Mixed Performances

Publication Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: [News Website]

The domestic equity market showed positive momentum at the start of trading on Tuesday, with the S&P BSE SENSEX rising significantly, while mixed performances were observed in individual stocks.

  • The S&P BSE SENSEX was up 394.39 points, trading at 78,359.38.
  • The NSE's NIFTY50 index gained 135.60 points, reaching 23,751.65.
  • 43 out of 50 NIFTY50 components were in the green, while Zomato faced a notable decline.
  • Top gainers on the index included ONGC, Titan, and BPCL.
  • Zomato shares dropped over 4% amid concerns over competition.
“2025 could be a breather year for Zomato, with the stock likely shifting gears into a phase of price consolidation.” - Jefferies Analysts

The market showed broad sectoral gains, with oil and gas leading, while foreign institutional investors reportedly sold equities worth ₹2,575.06 crore yesterday.

item.title: Air India flight makes emergency landing after engine shuts off midair - The Hindu
item.description:
Air India Flight 2820 Makes Emergency Landing Due to Engine Failure

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A Delhi-bound Air India flight made an emergency landing after one of its engines shut off midair. The flight, that took off from Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru, returned safely with no incidents reported.

  • The incident occurred on January 5, 2024, shortly after takeoff.
  • Flight 2820 took off around 7 p.m. and circled Bengaluru before landing an hour later.
  • All passengers were reported safe with no injuries.
No untoward incident happened and all the passengers were safe.

This emergency landing highlights the importance of aircraft safety and protocol in the aviation industry.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 7: Manappuram Finance, Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea, BPCL, Bajaj Finserv, Kalyan Jewellers, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch, January 7

Date: January 7, 2024

Source: Market Insights

The domestic equity market is expected to open positively today, following a rise in Asian shares and on the back of hopes for a less aggressive tariff approach from the incoming US President.

  • Bajaj Finserv: Reported a general insurance premium of ₹1,331 crore and life insurance premium of ₹1,055 crore for December.
  • Kalyan Jewellers: Achieved a consolidated revenue growth of approximately 39% YoY, with India operations up 41%.
  • Adani Enterprises: Entered a joint venture with Thailand's Indorama Resources for petrochemicals.
  • Manappuram Finance: Confirmed a daylight robbery incident at a branch in Odisha, with a loss of gold and cash.
  • ICICI Prudential Life: Received a GST tax demand order for FY2019 to FY2021.
  • Caplin Point: Received an Establishment Inspection Report from the US FDA with zero observations.
  • BPCL, GAIL, IGL: Maharashtra Natural Gas plans to launch an IPO exceeding ₹1,000 crore.
  • M&M: Increased production by 19.92% year-on-year in December 2024.
  • Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea: Agreed to sell their stakes in Firefly Networks to iBus Network.
“The company remains on track to achieve double-digit growth for the full financial year.” - SH Kelkar

The market's positive outlook today reflects various key developments, and investors are advised to watch these stocks closely.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing Date, Share Price LIVE: Stock to list on the NSE and the BSE today - Upstox
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing Date, Share Price LIVE

Date: January 7, 2023
Source: Upstox

The shares of Indo Farm Equipment were listed at a premium on the National Stock Exchange, reflecting strong investor interest during the IPO.

  • Shares debuted at ₹256, a premium of 19.07% over the issue price of ₹215.
  • The current stock price as of 10:39 am is ₹282.21, up 10.24%.
  • The IPO was subscribed 229.68 times, indicating high demand.
  • The minimum lot size for retail investors was set at 69 shares.
  • Proceeds from the IPO will be used for business expansion and loan repayment.
"The non-institutional investors led the demand, subscribing 503.83 times their portion."

The successful listing of Indo Farm Equipment's shares marks a significant event in the financial market, showcasing the company's strong market interest and backing by investors.

item.title: 10 Features The Hyundai Creta Electric Borrows From Its ICE Version - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric vs The Creta: 10 Features Electric Version Borrows From ICE Model

Publication Date: Scheduled for January 17, 2025
Source: CarDekho.com

Hyundai has unveiled the features of the upcoming Creta Electric, which shares styling and cabin layout with the ICE-powered model. The report highlights ten key features focused on convenience and safety borrowed from the regular Creta.

  • Dual 10.25-inch screens for infotainment and digital driver display.
  • Panoramic sunroof available in both models.
  • 8-speaker Bose sound system for premium audio experience.
  • Ventilated front-row seats for comfort.
  • Dual-zone automatic climate control for personalized comfort.
  • Standard 6 airbags across all variants for safety.
  • 360-degree camera system for parking assistance.
  • Level-2 ADAS for advanced safety features.
  • All-wheel disc brakes with electronic parking brake.
  • Tyre pressure monitoring system for real-time alerts.
“Prices for the Hyundai Creta Electric are set to be announced on January 17, 2025, at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Expo.”

The Creta Electric aims to compete with models like Tata Curvv EV, MG ZS EV, and Maruti Suzuki e Vitara.

item.title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on January 7 as HMPV virus cases rise | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indian Stock Market Outlook for January 7 Amid Rising HMPV Virus Cases

Publication Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market is anticipated to open higher on January 7 following positive trends in global markets, despite experiencing a significant downturn on January 6.

  • Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty 50 fell sharply on January 6, with Sensex dropping 1,258.12 points and Nifty 50 slipping below 23,700.
  • Gift Nifty indicates a potential upward opening for Nifty 50.
  • Short-term trends suggest potential further weakness with next support levels around 23,500 to 23,400.
  • Technical indicators present a mixed outlook, with caution advised due to unclear market direction.
  • Bank Nifty also faced declines and is nearing critical support zones.
“The candle pattern of Monday is indicating a bull trap of recent upside breakout and this signals more weakness in the short term.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst

The market's immediate trajectory remains uncertain, with investors advised to monitor key support and resistance levels closely.

item.description:
Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today

Date: 7 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

On 7 January 2025, the Indian stock market experienced a bearish trend, with the Nifty 50 index dropping significantly. Sumeet Bagadia from Choice Broking has recommended five breakout stocks for investors to consider amidst the current market conditions.

Sumeet Bagadia's breakout stock recommendations

  • PNGS Gargi Fashion Jewellery: Buy at ₹1372.20, target ₹1470, stop loss ₹1320.
  • PTC Industries: Buy at ₹15500, target ₹17000, stop loss ₹15000.
  • JTL Industries: Buy at ₹104.25, target ₹111, stop loss ₹100.
  • NDR Auto Components: Buy at ₹795, target ₹850, stop loss ₹770.
  • Vijaya Diagnostic Centre: Buy at ₹1126.30, target ₹1212, stop loss ₹1085.
“The Indian stock market trend has turned weak after sharp selling on Monday. The Nifty 50 index has closed near the 23,600 mark, and it may try to test 23,300 levels if its current support placed at 23,500 is breached.” - Sumeet Bagadia

Investors are advised to take a stock-specific approach given the uncertain market conditions and the upcoming Q3 2024-25 results.

item.title: Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three stocks to buy today — January 7 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three stocks to buy today — January 7

Date: January 7 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market saw a significant downturn on January 6, with concerns arising from a new virus outbreak in China. The Nifty 50 index declined 1.62%, prompting investor fears.

  • The Nifty 50 closed at 23,616.05 points, down from 24,004.75 points.
  • The BSE Sensex index closed at 77,964.99 points, down from 79,223.11 points.
  • Analyst Vaishali Parekh identified a bearish trend, predicting support at 23,400 points.
  • Parekh recommended three stocks to buy: Kopran Ltd., Metropolis Healthcare Ltd., and National Aluminium Co. Ltd.
“Nifty tanked significantly, losing almost 400 points to end near 23,600 zone, with a big bearish candle formation on the daily chart.” - Vaishali Parekh

The article concludes by advising investors to consult certified experts before making investment decisions.

item.title: Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Big 4 in India outshine MNC parents; combined revenue seen at over Rs 45,000 crore in FY25

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Economic Times

The Indian arms of the Big Four consulting firms are projected to surpass Rs 45,000 crore in combined revenue in FY25, driven by significant growth in consulting services amidst a slowing economy.

  • The Indian affiliates of Deloitte, PwC, EY, and KPMG outpaced their global parents in FY24 revenue growth.
  • Estimated revenue for the Indian firms in FY24 was around Rs 38,500-38,800 crore.
  • Consulting services generated over Rs 25,000 crore for these firms in FY24.
  • EY is expected to grow 23-25% in FY25, with a focus on consulting services.
  • Tax services across firms generated over Rs 6,000 crore in FY24, with growth expected between 12% and 23% in FY25.
“We will grow 23-25% in FY25. For Deloitte India now, more than 60% of revenue comes from various consulting services.” - Romal Shetty, CEO, Deloitte South Asia.

The growth prospects remain strong for the Big Four in India, as they adapt to changing market demands while facing challenges related to workload management and revenue-sharing with global partners.

item.title: Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens, Know Details - News18
item.description:
Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 21:37 IST

SBI has launched a new variant of term deposit ‘SBI Patrons’ for Super Senior Citizens. This scheme aims to provide greater financial benefits to individuals aged 80 and above.

  • ‘SBI Patrons’ offers an interest rate of 10 bps above the card rates for senior citizens.
  • Available to existing and new term deposit customers.
  • Eligibility extends to individuals aged 80 and above, either singly or jointly.
  • Minimum deposit amount is Rs 1,000, with a maximum of less than Rs 3 crore.
  • Deposit period ranges from 7 days to 10 years.
“Recognition of patronage of Super Senior Citizens by providing them additional benefits in terms of rate of interest.”

This scheme reflects SBI's commitment to supporting the financial needs of senior citizens, ensuring they receive higher returns on their investments.

item.title: EUR/USD Price Forecast: Climbs but struggles at 1.0400 - FXStreet
item.description:
EUR/USD Price Forecast: Climbs but struggles at 1.0400

Date: Not specified Source: FXStreet

The EUR/USD currency pair has ascended over 0.78%, supported by US tariff implications and a weakened dollar. Currently, it is trading above 1.0400 with expectations of further resistance ahead.

  • The EUR/USD has risen over 0.78% due to potential tariff announcements in the US and a weak dollar.
  • Technical analysis shows the pair has crossed 1.0400, indicating a buyer's market with further resistance expected.
  • Short-term support and resistance are identified at 1.0222 and 1.0500, with the 50-day SMA at 1.0558 acting as a critical resistance point.
"If buyers want to push the EUR/USD higher, they need to decisively clear 1.0400, followed by 1.0500."

In conclusion, the EUR/USD has shown some bullish momentum but will need to surpass key resistance levels to maintain this upward trajectory.

item.title: Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit - Decrypt
item.description:
Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Will Pay $5 Million to Settle CFTC Bitcoin Futures Lawsuit

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Decrypt

The Gemini Trust Company has agreed to a $5 million settlement with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) to resolve allegations of misleading regulators regarding its Bitcoin futures product.

  • The settlement avoids a trial that was set for January 21, 2025.
  • Gemini did not admit to or deny any wrongdoing.
  • The CFTC filed the lawsuit accusing Gemini of making material false statements to obtain approval for its Bitcoin futures.
  • The lawsuit claimed Gemini should have known its statements were misleading.
  • Winklevoss twins have been influential in the crypto space and made donations to political campaigns.
“Gemini knew or reasonably should have known that the statements and information by the company were false or misleading.”

This settlement showcases the ongoing regulatory scrutiny in the cryptocurrency sector and the efforts by firms to comply with regulations.

item.title: 2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know - News18
item.description:
2025 Ather 450 Series Launched: All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 06, 2025, 16:35 IST | Source: Ather Energy

The 2025 Ather 450 series has been launched with significant upgrades to enhance performance and safety features.

  • The Ather 450X and 450 Apex now have Multi-Mode Traction Control and MagicTwistTM for improved riding experience in city traffic.
  • Pricing starts at Rs 1,29,999 for the 450S, and goes up to Rs 1,99,999 for the 450 Apex model.
  • The scooters are powered by AtherStackTM 6, integrating advanced connectivity features including Google Maps and Live Location Sharing.
  • The range for the 450X with a 3.7 kWh battery is up to 130 km, and the 450 Apex offers 157 km range.
  • An extended warranty of up to 8 years or 80,000 km is offered, ensuring 70% battery health assurance.
“Now, with the 2025 Ather 450, we are improving the safety of the scooters with features like multi-mode traction control which is typically found in high end motorcycles.” - Ravneet S. Phokela, Chief Business Officer of Ather Energy

The 2025 Ather 450 series combines modern technology with safety enhancements, making it an appealing choice for urban commuters.

item.title: MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million - Decrypt
item.description:
MicroStrategy Continues Weekly Bitcoin Buying Spree With Another $101 Million

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 Source: Decrypt

Software company MicroStrategy is pushing forward with its Bitcoin buying spree in 2025, today snapping up more than $100 million worth of the orange coin.

MicroStrategy spent $101 million buying 1,070 BTC at an average price of $94,004, maintaining a weekly buying trend that started in November. The total Bitcoin holdings now stand at 447,470, valued at over $45.5 billion.

  • MicroStrategy has made nine consecutive weekly Bitcoin purchases.
  • Today's purchase is significantly lower than previous weeks.
  • There are predictions that the company will hold at least 450,000 BTC by the end of the week.
  • Concerns raised about the company’s high leverage and stock valuation amidst Bitcoin's fluctuating price.
MicroStrategy has acquired 1,070 BTC for ~$101 million at ~$94,004 per bitcoin and has achieved BTC Yield of 48.0% in Q4 2024 and 74.3% in FY 2024.

In conclusion, MicroStrategy's aggressive Bitcoin purchasing strategy demonstrates its commitment to accumulating the cryptocurrency, even as concerns about market stability rise.

item.title: How 16.73 billion UPI transactions killed the ubiquitous toffee business | Mint - Mint
item.description:
How 16.73 Billion UPI Transactions Impacted India's Toffee Business

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)

India's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions soared to 16.73 billion in December 2024, profoundly affecting the traditional toffee or candy business.

  • UPI transactions increased by 8% month-on-month, compared to 15.28 billion transactions in November 2024.
  • The cultural practice of giving candies as change has declined, impacting toffee sales.
  • Approximately 30 million small shops in India were affected by this shift in transaction methods.
Harshad Shah, a chartered accountant, stated: “Before UPI, shopkeepers would trade Toffees for small change, stating shortage of Coins.”

As digital payments grow in prevalence, the toffee industry's fortunes hinge on changing consumer behavior and payment methods.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 7: ICICI Prudential, Bajaj Finserv, Manappuram Finance, Ashoka Buildcon and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 7: ICICI Prudential, Bajaj Finserv, Manappuram Finance, Ashoka Buildcon and more

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights significant stock movements and announcements from various companies as of January 7, 2025.

  • ICICI Prudential: Received a GST demand order upheld by the Commissioner on January 6.
  • Caplin Point: FDA inspection concluded with zero observations at Gummidipoondi facility.
  • Bajaj Finserv: Gross direct premium for December reaches ₹1,330.9 crore.
  • Manappuram Finance: Incident of daylight robbery reported with a loss of ₹20 crore.
  • Ashoka Buildcon: Secured a ₹1,391 crore project for a new economic corridor in West Bengal.
  • NESCO: Declared highest bidder for wayside amenities along the Bengaluru-Chennai Expressway.
  • SH Kelkar: Reported 17% YoY revenue growth with plans for double-digit growth.
  • Nuvoco Vistas: Selected bidder for Vadraj Cement’s assets in the corporate insolvency resolution process.
  • Akzo Nobel: Proposed strategic evaluation for powder coatings business.
  • Power Grid: Won two significant projects under the TBCB process for transmission upgrades.
  • Bharti Airtel: Sells 50% stake in Firefly Networks for ₹45 million.
  • Coal India: Partnered with IREL for critical mineral development.
  • Vodafone Idea: Sold 50% stake in Firefly Networks for ₹4.5 crore.
  • IndiGo: Imposed a ₹2.17 crore penalty from customs authority.
  • ICICI Securities: Settled a Sebi case by paying ₹40.2 lakh.

item.title: Upcoming IPO: BPCL's update on joint venture company's Rs 1000 crore public issue - Details - ET Now
item.description:
Upcoming IPO: BPCL's update on joint venture company's Rs 1000 crore public issue

Updated: Jan 6, 2025 Source: ET Now

Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) has announced the upcoming public issue of its joint venture company Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) with plans for an IPO aimed at raising over Rs 1000 crore.

  • MNGL is a city gas distribution joint venture comprising BPCL, GAIL (India), and Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL).
  • The IPO is expected to include an offer for sale (OFS) and a fresh issue of shares.
  • IGL currently holds 50% of MNGL, with BPCL and GAIL each owning 22.5%.
  • The IPO proceeds are forecasted to be used for expanding operations in various regions.
  • MNGL has a significant infrastructure, including 246 CNG stations and almost 858,000 domestic piped natural gas connections.
  • Upon listing, MNGL would be the sixth pure-play city gas distribution entity to go public.
"It is the most profitable joint venture we have, and we plan to unlock value for investors. MNGL will raise over Rs 1,000 crore. The proceeds will be used to expand operations," an official stated.

This move marks a significant step for BPCL and its partners as they navigate the capital markets to enhance their growth strategies in the energy sector.

item.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Up Amid Trump Tariff Hopes; Nvidia, Chip Stocks Gain On This (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
item.description:
Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Up As Trump Says This On Tariffs; Nvidia Pops As 3 Stocks Clear Entries (Live Coverage)

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Investors.com

The stock market saw positive momentum with the Dow Jones Industrial Average gaining nearly 400 points influenced by President Trump's remarks on tariffs and strong performance from tech stocks, particularly Nvidia.

  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose nearly 400 points, or 0.9%.
  • Nvidia surged by nearly 5%, clearing the 146.54 buy point of a double-bottom base.
  • FuboTV's stock price more than doubled after announcing a deal with Walt Disney.
  • Chip stocks rallied following Foxconn's impressive Q4 revenue report.
  • The Nasdaq composite rose about 2%, pulling further above its 21-day exponential moving average.
  • Trump denied reports of a reduced tariff policy, labeling them as 'Fake News.'
"The story in the Washington Post... incorrectly states that my tariff policy will be pared back. That is wrong." - Donald Trump

This day marked a significant rally in the stock market, particularly in the tech sector, indicating a bullish trend as multiple stocks break clear buy points.

item.title: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm - DNA India
item.description:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm

Publication Date: January 6, 2025

Source: DNA India

Mukesh Ambani continues to expand his business empire with the introduction of a new rehydrating beverage, RasKik Gluco Energy, priced at just Rs 10 per single-serve drink. This move follows Reliance's recent acquisition of Campa Cola and positions the company to compete directly with Tata Consumer Products in the beverage market.

  • Reliance's market cap stands at Rs 16.48 lakh crore.
  • The RasKik Gluco Energy beverage aims to redefine rehydration in India.
  • Products currently offered include mango, apple, mixed fruit, coconut water, and nimbu pani.
  • Reliance aims to expand its portfolio inspired by regional fruit varieties.
"RasKik is now uniquely positioned to provide a variety of accessible and great quality fruit-based drinks." - Reliance Consumer Products Ltd

This product launch exemplifies Reliance's commitment to merging traditional Indian consumer heritage with modern product offerings, highlighting the company's ambition to become a leader in the beverage sector.
